intro: Baillonacanthus, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plants typically have opposite, ovate leaves and produce showy, clustered flowers in shades of yellow or orange. Baillonacanthus species are often shrubs or small trees, characterized by their spiny stems and latex-filled tissues. They are adapted to arid environments and are sometimes used in traditional medicine.
